quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.
As long as I have a want, I have a reason for living. Satisfaction is death.
Chance corrects us of many faults that reason would not know how to correct.
Fortitude is the marshal of thought, the armor of the will, and the fort of reason.
Reason is a whore, surviving by simulation, versatility, and shamelessness.
A man always has two reasons for doing anything - a good reason and the real reason.
Common looking people are the best in the world: that is the reason the Lord makes so many of them.
Faith... is the art of holding on to things your reason once accepted, despite your changing moods.
Our passion and principals are constantly in a frenzy, but begin to shift and waver, as we return to reason.

Faith... is the art of holding on to things your reason once accepted, despite your changing moods.
Our passion and principals are constantly in a frenzy, but begin to shift and waver, as we return to reason.
A little flesh, a little breath, and a Reason to rule all - that is myself.
A man's real life is that accorded to him in the thoughts of other men by reason of respect or natural love.
A noble heart will always capitulate to reason.
A person usually has two reasons for doing something: a good reason and the real reason.
A sort of war of revenge on the intellect is what, for some reason, thrives in the contemporary social atmosphere.
An alibi is a reason with a bad reputation.
An angry man is again angry with himself when he returns to reason.
An appeal to the reason of the people has never been known to fail in the long run.

Aptitude found in the understanding and is often inherited. Genius coming from reason and imagination, rarely.
As reason is a rebel to faith, so passion is a rebel to reason.
As soon as questions of will or decision or reason or choice of action arise, human science is at a loss.
Authority has every reason to fear the skeptic, for authority can rarely survive in the face of doubt.
By logic and reason we die hourly; by imagination we live.
Childhood is the sleep of reason.
Conscience is our magnetic compass; reason our chart.
Dawn: When men of reason go to bed.
Deprived of meaningful work, men and women lose their reason for existence; they go stark, raving mad.
Do not seek the because - in love there is no because, no reason, no explanation, no solutions.
Do not seek to find a reason why elections are not possible. Seek to make them possible, and they will be possible.
Earnestness is enthusiasm tempered by reason.
Emotions have taught mankind to reason.
Errors of opinion may be tolerated where reason is left free to combat it.
Every existing thing is born without reason, prolongs itself out of weakness, and dies by chance.
Everything happens for a reason and a purpose, and it serves you.
Everything that is beautiful and noble is the product of reason and calculation.
Faith begins where Reason sinks exhausted.
Faith is a higher faculty than reason.

Faith must trample under foot all reason, sense, and understanding.

Fate is the endless chain of causation, whereby things are; the reason or formula by which the world goes on.
Fear of failure must never be a reason not to try something.
Fortitude is the marshal of thought, the armor of the will, and the fort of reason.
G is Grace, the Flaming Star is the Torch of Reason. Those who possess this knowledge are indeed Illuminati.
Good advice is always certain to be ignored, but that's no reason not to give it.
Habit is stronger than reason.
He never does a proper thing without giving an improper reason for it.
He only employs his passion who can make no use of his reason.
He that cannot reason is a fool. He that will not is a bigot. He that dare not is a slave.
He that will not reason is a bigot; he that cannot reason is a fool; and he that dares not reason is a slave.

Human reason needs only to will more strongly than fate, and she is fate.
I am sure that since I have had the full use of my reason, nobody has heard me laugh.
I finally figured out the only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.
I go on working for the same reason that a hen goes on laying eggs.
I must create a system or be enslaved by another man s; I will not reason and compare: my business is to create.
I prefer the company of peasants because they have not been educated sufficiently to reason incorrectly.
I see men ordinarily more eager to discover a reason for things than to find out whether the things are so.
I see no reason why anyone would want a computer in their home.
I use emotion for the many and reserve reason for the few.
I would uphold the law if for no other reason but to protect myself.
I write for the same reason I breathe - because if I didn't, I would die.
I'll not listen to reason. Reason always means what someone else has got to say.
I'm sure one reason I became an actor is my basic unwillingness to live one life.
If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins.
If they had not landed there would be some reason for celebrating the fact.

In all private quarrels the duller nature is triumphant by reason of dullness.
Insanity destroys reason, but not wit.

Man is to be found in reason, God in the passions.

Men live by intervals of reason under the sovereignty of humor and passion.
Men often make up in wrath what they want in reason.
More in prosperity is reason tost than ships in storms, their helms and anchors lost.
Most men seem to live according to sense rather than reason.
My reason is not framed to bend or stoop: my knees are.
Neither great poverty nor great riches will hear reason.
Never get angry. Never make a threat. Reason with people.

No matter what political reasons are given for war, the underlying reason is always economic.

No wickedness proceeds on any grounds of reason.

One reason I don't drink is that I want to know when I am having a good time.
One should always be in love. That is the reason one should never marry.
Only those things are beautiful which are inspired by madness and written by reason.
Our prejudices are our mistresses; reason is at best our wife, very often heard indeed, but seldom minded.
Our reason may prove what it will: our reason is only a feeble ray that has issued from Nature.
Passion and prejudice govern the world; only under the name of reason.
Passion is the mob of the man, that commits a riot upon his reason.
People travel for the same reason as they collect works of art: because the best people do it.

Prejudices are what fools use for reason.

Reason also is choice.

Reason guides but a small part of man, and the rest obeys feeling, true or false, and passion, good or bad.

Reason is a harmonizing, controlling force rather than a creative one.
Reason is a very light rider, and easily shook off.
Reason is a whore, the greatest enemy that faith has.
Reason is our soul's left hand, faith her right, by these we reach divinity.
Reason is the enemy of faith.
Reason is the historian, but passions are the actors.
Reason is the substance of the universe, the design of the world is absolutely rational.
Reason often makes mistakes, but conscience never does.
Reason over passion.
Reason should direct and appetite obey.
Reason, observation, and experience; the holy trinity of science.

Science when well digested is nothing but good sense and reason.

Some people wave their dogmatic thinking until their own reason is entangled.

The only reason I would take up jogging is so that I could hear heavy breathing again.

The only reason they come to see me is that I know that life is great - and they know I know it.

The reason there's so much ignorance is that those who have it are so eager to share it.
The reason why men do not obey us is because they see the mud at the bottom of our eye.
The reason why people so of ten disagree in discussion is that they sar what they do not think.
The reason why so few good books are written is that so few people who can write know anything.
The reason why so little is done, is generally because so little is attempted.
The reason why worry kills more people than work is that more people worry than work.

The sure conviction that we could if we wanted to is the reason so many good minds are idle.

The true man wants two things: danger and play. For that reason he wants woman, as the most dangerous plaything.
The true triumph of reason is that it enables us to get along with those who do not possess it.
The truth is, man is hereunto led by reason which is his nature.
The vast majority of human beings are not interested in reason or satisfied with what it teaches.
The war existing between the senses and reason.
The way to see by Faith is to shut the Eye of Reason.

The wise are instructed by reason, average minds by experience, the stupid by necessity and the brute by instinct.
The world has always gone through periods of madness so as to advance a bit on the road to reason.
The world is indebted for all triumphs which have been gained by reason and humanity over error and oppression.

Theirs is not to make reply: Theirs is not to reason why: Theirs is but to do and die.

Time makes more converts than reason.

To say the truth, reason and love keep little company together now-a-days.

Treason doth never prosper, what's the reason? For if it prosper, none dare call it treason.

Use the losses and failures of the past as a reason for action, not inaction.

Youth doesn't reason, it acts. The old man reasons and would like to make the others act in his place.
Youth is ever apt to judge in haste,
Youth smiles without any reason. It is one of its chiefest charms.
